etymology.description: Depicts the top of a head
etymology.interpretation: The character 亠(tóu, 'top mark') is a pictograph representing the top or crown of the head. Its simple line and dot visually convey this concept.

examples.chinese: 这个字以亠为顶(這個字以亠為頂)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè ge zì yǐ tóu wéi dǐng.
examples.english: This character uses 亠 as its top.

examples.chinese: 书法中讲究笔画(書法中講究筆畫)，亠常被用作装饰(亠常被用作裝飾)。
examples.pinyin: Shūfǎ zhōng jiǎngjiù bǐhuà, tóu cháng bèi yòng zuò zhuāngshì.
examples.english: Calligraphy emphasizes brushstrokes, and 亠 is often used as decoration.

examples.chinese: 古文中出现亠(古文中出現亠)，寓意崇高(寓意崇高)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔwén zhōng chūxiàn tóu, yùyì chónggāo.
examples.english: In classical texts, 亠 appears, symbolizing loftiness.
